# Matlab R2016a
isocrack:[](http://pan.baidu.com/s/1nuHAUCh)

## 1. 
```linux
sudo mkdir /media/matlab
sudo mount -o loop ~/Downloads/R2016a_glnxa64.iso /media/matlab/ //iso/matlab
cd /media/matlab
sudo ./install
```

## 2.
- ,(crackFIK).
- , /usr/local/MATLAB/R2016a.
- ,matlab.
```linux
cd /usr/local/MATLAB/R2016a/bin/glnxa64/
sudo MATLAB
```
,crackMatlab_R2016a_glnxa64.lic.

- crackmatlab.
```linux
sudo cp ~/Downloads/crack/libcufft.so.7.5.18 /usr/local/MATLAB/R2016a/bin/glnxa64/
 sudo cp ~/Downloads/crack/libmwservices.so /usr/local/MATLAB/R2016a/bin/glnxa64/
```

## 3. 
- PATH/usr/local/MATLAB,matlab,
`sudo ln -s /usr/local/MATLAB/R2016a/bin/glnxa64/MATLAB /usr/local/bin/matlab
`
- ,,/usr/share/applications/Matlab.desktop,

        [Desktop Entry]
        Type = Application
        Name = Matlab
        GenericName = Matlab R2016a
        Comment = Matlab R2016a: The Language of the Technical Computing
        Exec = /usr/local/MATLAB/R2016a/bin/glnxa64/MATLAB -desktop //
        Icon = /usr/local/MATLAB/matlab.png // 
        StartupNotify = true
        Terminal = false
        Categories = Development;Matlab;
`sudo chmod a+x Matlab.desktop`.
[](http://upload-images.jianshu.io/upload_images/825093-3a8333c910981276.png?imageMogr2/auto-orient/strip%7CimageView2/2/w/120).
![Matlab](http://upload-images.jianshu.io/upload_images/825093-3a8333c910981276.png?imageMogr2/auto-orient/strip%7CimageView2/2/w/120)

- matlab~/.matab`sudo chown [your ubuntu username] -R ~/.matlab`

## 4. 
- :MatlabPreferencesFontsUse antialising to smooth desktop fonts.
- :,Preferences->Fonts,ok,AR PL Ukai CN()
- EmacsPreferences->Keyboard->Shortcuts->Active settingsWindows Default set.

Post.title: Tensorflow
Post._content:
scopeTensorflow

```python
tf.name_scope()
tf.op_scope()
tf.variable_scope()
tf.variable_op_scope()
```
`tf.name_scope``tf.op_scope`values


```python
tf.name_scope(name, default_name=None, values=None)
tf.op_scope(values, name, default_name=None)
```

`tf.variable_scope``tf.variable_op_scope`



****`tf.get_variable()`

`tf.get_variable()`
- `tf.get_variable('name', ...)` namename
- `tf.Variable()``tf.get_variable()``tf.Variable()`


`tf.variable_scope``tf.get_variable`

- `tf.get_variable('name', ...)`name
- `reuse = True`
- `tf.get_variable('name', ...)`
- **`tf.variable_scope('name')``tf.name_scope('name')`**



- 
- `tf.get_variable`
- `tf.get_variable`



```python
with tf.variable_scope("foo"):
    v = tf.get_variable("v", [1])
    x = 1.0 + v
assert v.name == "foo/v:0"
assert x.op.name == "foo/add"
assert x.name == "foo/add:0"

with tf.variable_scope("foo", reuse = True):
    with tf.name_scope("bar"):
        v = tf.get_variable("v", [1])
        x = 1.0 + v
        y = 1.0 + x
assert v.name == "foo/v:0"  # 
assert x.op.name == "foo_1/bar/add"  # foo
assert x.name == "foo_1/bar/add:0"
assert y.op.name == "foo_1/bar/add_1" # add


# 

with tf.name_scope('t1') as scope:
    with tf.name_scope('t2'):
        with tf.name_scope(scope):
            x = tf.Variable(1)
assert x.op.name == 't1/Variable'

with tf.name_scope('t1') as scope:
    with tf.name_scope('t2'):
        with tf.name_scope('t3'):
            x = tf.Variable(1, name = scope) # 
assert x.op.name == 't1_1'
```

`tf.variable_scope()``tf.get_variable()`[-Wiki](http://wiki.jikexueyuan.com/project/tensorflow-zh/how_tos/variable_scope.html)

```python
with tf.variable_scope("foo"):
    v = tf.get_variable("v", [1])
    x = 1.0 + v
assert v.name == "foo/v:0"
assert x.op.name == "foo/add"
assert x.name == "foo/add:0"

with tf.variable_scope("foo", reuse = True):
    with tf.name_scope("bar"):
        v = tf.get_variable("v", [1])
        x = 1.0 + v
        y = 1.0 + x
assert v.name == "foo/v:0"  # 
assert x.op.name == "foo_1/bar/add"  # foo
assert x.name == "foo_1/bar/add:0"
assert y.op.name == "foo_1/bar/add_1" # add


# 

with tf.name_scope('t1') as scope:
    with tf.name_scope('t2'):
        with tf.name_scope(scope):
            x = tf.Variable(1)
assert x.op.name == 't1/Variable'

with tf.name_scope('t1') as scope:
    with tf.name_scope('t2'):
        with tf.name_scope('t3'):
            x = tf.Variable(1, name = scope) # 
assert x.op.name == 't1_1'
```

# Vim
Ubuntuvimvim.tinygvim,`sudo apt-get install vim-gtk` `apt-get``vim+youcompleteme`vim`rubynodejs,ycmd``ycmd`vim...github`youcompleteme`,

<!-- more -->

## Vundle
Vundlevim
```git
$ git clone https://github.com/VundleVim/Vundle.vim.git ~/.vim/bundle/Vundle.vim
```

`.vimrc`
```
set nocompatible              " be iMproved, required
filetype off                  " required

" set the runtime path to include Vundle and initialize
set rtp+=~/.vim/bundle/Vundle.vim
call vundle#begin()
" alternatively, pass a path where Vundle should install plugins
"call vundle#begin('~/some/path/here')

" let Vundle manage Vundle, required
Plugin 'VundleVim/Vundle.vim'

" The following are examples of different formats supported.
" Keep Plugin commands between vundle#begin/end.
" plugin on GitHub repo
Plugin 'tpope/vim-fugitive'
" plugin from http://vim-scripts.org/vim/scripts.html
" Plugin 'L9'
" Git plugin not hosted on GitHub
Plugin 'git://git.wincent.com/command-t.git'
" git repos on your local machine (i.e. when working on your own plugin)
Plugin 'file:///home/gmarik/path/to/plugin'
" The sparkup vim script is in a subdirectory of this repo called vim.
" Pass the path to set the runtimepath properly.
Plugin 'rstacruz/sparkup', {'rtp': 'vim/'}
" Install L9 and avoid a Naming conflict if you've already installed a
" different version somewhere else.
" Plugin 'ascenator/L9', {'name': 'newL9'}

" All of your Plugins must be added before the following line
call vundle#end()            " required
filetype plugin indent on    " required
" To ignore plugin indent changes, instead use:
"filetype plugin on
"
" Brief help
" :PluginList       - lists configured plugins
" :PluginInstall    - installs plugins; append `!` to update or just :PluginUpdate
" :PluginSearch foo - searches for foo; append `!` to refresh local cache
" :PluginClean      - confirms removal of unused plugins; append `!` to auto-approve removal
"
" see :h vundle for more details or wiki for FAQ
" Put your non-Plugin stuff after this line
```

```
" plugin on GitHub repo

```

```
"Wei Lyu

    call setline(1, "#!/usr/bin/env python3")

    normal o
    normal o
endf

map <F8> :call Rungdb()<CR>
```
